alert.note: Alert for Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Steuben; Tompkins; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Seneca, northern Schuyler, southeastern Yates, southwestern Cayuga, east central Steuben and northwestern Tompkins Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Kendaia to near Himrod to near Hammondsport. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bath, Hector, Romulus, Starkey, Fleming, Covert, Ledyard, Watkins Glen, Trumansburg and Dundee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New York.

area.areaDesc: Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Steuben; Tompkins; Yates
